summary: This is a cover email from defense attorney Christian R Everdell to Judge Nathan, submitting a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits under seal in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The attachments include a redacted memorandum and five redacted exhibits.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the document title and the subject of the renewed bail motion.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the email and attached bail motion are addressed.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: The attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is submitting the bail motion and exhibits to the court on behalf of the defendant.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting a bail motion on behalf of defendant Maxwell, indicating he is acting as her legal counsel.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Renewed Bail Motion Filed
events.description: Defense counsel files a renewed bail application and supporting exhibits under seal in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A renewed bail motion was filed under seal on December 8, 2020, in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The motion was submitted by defense attorney Christian R Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP to Judge Nathan.
The filing includes a redacted memorandum and five redacted exhibits (A through E).
The document is a cover email transmitting the sealed court filings, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in Maxwell's case.
